ProjectDescr.Title: Loss-of-function mutations in ZNF750 contribute to acanthotic type of seborrheic keratosis
ProjectDescr.Description: Seborrheic keratosis (SK) is one of the most common benign skin tumors usually affects head, neck, and trunk. Genetics studies revealed that somatic variants that activate FGFR3 are found in 40-80% of SK tissues. However, the same hotspot mutations of FGFR3 found in SK were reported in physiologically normal epidermis, implying that the FGFR3 mutations alone do not cause SK. Also, since SK has histologically distinct subtypes, it is plausible that each subtype harbors different genetic abnormalities. We aim to understand SK pathogenesis through discovery of additional genetic factors.
